para.text: Signal words are divided into four classes based on the degree of expected risk.

para.text: Indicates an imminent hazard which, if not avoided, will result in death or serious injury.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:9px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: Indicates a potential hazard which, if not avoided, will result in death or serious injury.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:9px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: Indicates a possible hazard which, if not avoided, may result in minor or moderate injury.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:11px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:51px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: Indicates a potential situation which, if not avoided, may result in physical damage to the machine or adversely affect the work environment.
